questionText: Which Disney feature was the first to have its entire soundtrack recorded in stereo?
Disney's 'Pocahontas' was released the same year as 'Toy Story'.
Which ride at Disneyland was personally supervised by Walt Disney during construction?
The film 'Who Framed Roger Rabbit' featured both Disney and Warner Bros. cartoon characters.
Which Disney animated film was the first to be based on a fairy tale written by Hans Christian Andersen?
In the original Marvel Comics, what metal was used to coat Ultron's body making him nearly indestructible?
The original Human Torch in Marvel Comics was an android, not a human mutate like Johnny Storm.
Who was the first character to wield Thor's hammer Mjolnir in Marvel Comics aside from Thor himself?
In the comics, Scarlet Witch and Quicksilver were originally introduced as members of the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants.
What is the real name of the Marvel villain known as The Mandarin?
The name 'Ewok' is never actually spoken in 'Return of the Jedi'.
What is the name of Darth Vader's personal flagship Star Destroyer?
The design for the Millennium Falcon was inspired by a hamburger with an olive on the side.
Which actor played Grand Moff Tarkin in the original Star Wars film?
The original script for 'The Empire Strikes Back' had Obi-Wan Kenobi returning physically, not as a Force ghost.
What was the name of the animation system Pixar developed for 'Brave' to animate Merida's curly hair?
The Pixar film 'A Bug's Life' is loosely based on Aesop's fable 'The Ant and the Grasshopper'.
Which Pixar film features a character voiced by Paul Newman in his final film role?
The 'Luxo Ball' that appears in many Pixar films features a star inside a red stripe.
What was the code name for 'Finding Nemo' during its production?
In the original 'The Legend of Zelda', the second quest is unlocked by beating the game and starting a new file with the name 'ZELDA'.
In 'Ocarina of Time', what is the name of the Gerudo leader who serves as Ganondorf's surrogate mother?
The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening was originally developed as a port of A Link to the Past for the Game Boy.
Which Zelda game first introduced the concept of alternate timelines?
In 'Breath of the Wild', it's possible to defeat the final boss without completing any of the Divine Beast quests.
